title: Gastric Adenocarcinoma
diagnosis_topic: Malignant tumor of the stomach requiring staging and resection
setup_script: A 65-year-old man with a history of smoking presents with weight loss, early satiety and vague epigastric discomfort. His stool tested positive for occult blood.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 130/70 mmHg, HR 90 bpm, RR 16/min, Temp 37 C.
Ulcerated mass in the antrum; biopsies show intestinal-type adenocarcinoma.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders CT scan and endoscopic ultrasound
dynamic_flow.reply: CT shows thickening of the gastric wall without distant metastasis; EUS indicates T2N1 lesion with 2 regional lymph nodes involved.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates nutritional status and co-morbidities
If resident discusses treatment plan with multidisciplinary team
dynamic_flow.reply: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy (FLOT) followed by subtotal gastrectomy with D2 lymphadenectomy is recommended.
Tumor progresses to unresectable stage or metastasis occurs.
Laparoscopic or open subtotal gastrectomy removing 5 cm margins; reconstruction with Billroth II or Roux-en-Y.
Improves survival in stage II/III disease; monitor for neutropenia and mucositis.
Early enteral feeding via jejunostomy, monitor for anastomotic leak, nutritional deficiencies (B12, iron) and dumping syndrome.
CT scans and endoscopic evaluation every 6 months for 2 years then annually.
Smoking cessation, dietary modifications and support resources.
Provide counseling and involve oncology social worker.

critical_decision_points: Diagnosis of gastric cancer via endoscopy and biopsy
Staging with CT and endoscopic ultrasound to determine depth and nodal involvement
Use of neoadjuvant chemotherapy and surgical resection with adequate lymphadenectomy
Postoperative nutritional management and surveillance for recurrence
Multidisciplinary care coordination and patient counseling
